channel.title: Groovy on Community Over Code Europe
channel.description: Recent content in Groovy on Community Over Code Europe

item.title: Classifying Iris flowers with Groovy, Deep Learning, and GraalVM
item.description: This talk looks at using Groovy for a well-known data-science problem: classifying Iris flowers. It involves solving this problem using the latest deep-learning neural network technologies and has the option of using GraalVM for blazing speed. Groovy provides a data-science environment with the simplicity of Python but using Java-like syntax and your favourite JVM technologies.

item.title: Getting Started with the Micronaut® Framework
item.description: In this session, Sergio del Amo introduces the Micronaut® framework and demonstrates how the Framework’s unique compile-time approach enables the development of ultra-lightweight Java applications. Compelling aspects of the Micronaut framework include: Develop applications with Java, Kotlin, or Apache Groovy Sub-second startup time Small processes that can run in as little as 10 MB of JVM heap No runtime reflection Dependency injection and AOP Reflection-free serialization A database access toolkit that uses ahead-of-time (AoT) compilation to pre-compute queries for repository interfaces.

item.title: Whisky Clustering with Apache Projects: Groovy, Commons Math, Ignite, Spark, Wayang and Beam
item.description: Calling all developers with a penchant for fine whiskey! Join Dr. Paul King, VP at Apache Groovy, on a quest to analyze whiskeys produced by the world’s top 86 distilleries to identify the perfect single-malt Scotch. How will he perform this analysis? By using the traditional and distributed K-means clustering algorithm from various Apache projects. Bottoms up!
